content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: IDVAR
      operator: is_not_valid_relationship
      context: RDOMAIN
      value: IDVARVAL
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.121
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: When IDVAR and IDVARVAL are populated those referenced values must exist
  in the parent domain identified in RDOMAIN.
Outcome:
  Message: IDVAR does not represent a variable present in the dataset identified in
    RDOMAIN
  Output Variables:
    - RDOMAIN
    - USUBJID
    - IDVAR
    - IDVARVAL
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '121'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Related to a specific parent record or group of parent
                  records, in which case the value of the variable RDOMAIN is set
                  to the DOMAIN code of the parent record(s), and the variables IDVAR
                  and IDVARVAL are populated with the key variable name and value
                  of the parent record(s). Assumptions for populating IDVAR and IDVARVAL
                  are further described in Section 8.2.
                Document: IG v.3.1
                Item: Specification
                Section: 5.2.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - CO
      - RELREC

json.Description: When IDVAR and IDVARVAL are populated those referenced values must exist in the parent domain identified in RDOMAIN.

Outcome.Message: IDVAR does not represent a variable present in the dataset identified in RDOMAIN

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Related to a specific parent record or group of parent records, in which case the value of the variable RDOMAIN is set to the DOMAIN code of the parent record(s), and the variables IDVAR and IDVARVAL are populated with the key variable name and value of the parent record(s). Assumptions for populating IDVAR and IDVARVAL are further described in Section 8.2.
